item.title: The Two Party System in the USA
item.description: The two party System in the USA Two major political parties have long dominated politics in the United States. And since the mid-1800s, those two main parties have been the Democrats and Republicans. Why do American voters generally face fewer choices at the ballot box? In fact, the nation became entrenched in a two-party system shortly after its founding. Here’s how fundamental disagreements over the role of the federal government and a winner-takes-all system drove American politics towards a two-party system.
